modules.description: Fundamentals of economic resource allocation and analysis, focusing on both individual and aggregate economic principles.
modules.title: Economics 1

modules.description: Concepts in real analysis, focusing on proofs and rigorous mathematical techniques.
modules.title: Analysis 1

modules.description: Concepts in real analysis, including Riemann integration and power series.
modules.title: Analysis 2

modules.description: Basics of linear algebra, including vectors, matrices, and their applications.
modules.title: Algebra 1

modules.description: Introduction to groups, rings, fields, and vector spaces.
modules.title: Algebra 2

modules.description: Concepts of group theory and linear algebra, essential for understanding mathematics and its applications.
modules.title: Algebra for Joint Honours

modules.description: Techniques for modelling and analysing systems in various contexts.
modules.title: Applied Mathematics

modules.description: Principles of Newtonian mechanics, including force, motion, and energy.
modules.title: Newtonian Mechanics

modules.description: Foundational skills across vectors, calculus, and differential equations.
modules.title: Mathematical Methods 1

modules.description: Programming fundamentals in Python and introductory multivariable calculus.
modules.lead: Dr M Towers and Prof R Halburd
modules.title: Mathematical Methods 2

modules.description: This course equips BASc students with fundamental calculus skills to prepare them for advanced studies and potential departmental placements.
modules.title: Mathematical Methods for Arts and Sciences

modules.description: Rigorous study of complex functions, covering fundamental theorems and applications.
modules.title: Analysis 3: Complex Analysis

modules.description: Polynomial rings, linear maps and matrices, and inner product spaces.
modules.title: Algebra 3: Further Linear Algebra

modules.description: Principles of fluid motion, focusing on planar flows, dynamics, and an introduction to surface waves.
modules.title: Fluid Mechanics

modules.description: Fourier analysis, calculus of variations, partial differential equations, and vector calculus.
modules.title: Mathematical Methods 3

modules.description: Foundations of measure theory and Lebesgue integration.
modules.title: Measure Theory

modules.description: Introduction to function spaces, Banach spaces and Hilbert spaces.
modules.title: Functional Analysis

modules.description: Key notions and theorems of analysis in $\mathbb{R}^n$, unifying vector analysis and differential forms.
modules.title: Multivariable Analysis

modules.description: Geometry of smooth curves and surfaces in $\mathbb{R}^3$, looking at local properties, global theorems, and minimal surfaces.
modules.title: Curves and Surfaces

modules.description: Generalising linear algebra via commutative rings, as an introduction to the theory of modules.
modules.title: Homological Algebra

modules.description: Introduction to Galois theory, bringing together ideas from groups, rings, and linear algebra.
modules.title: Galois Theory

modules.description: Introductory algebraic and geometric topology via the homology of simplicial complexes.
modules.title: Algebraic Toplogy

modules.description: Ocean and atmosphere dynamics, focussing on global weather and transport processes.
modules.title: Geophysical Fluid Dynamics

modules.description: Einstein’s revolutionary theories of relativity, including gravity and electromagnetism.
modules.title: Mathematics for General Relativity

modules.description: The mathematical study of the normal function in living systems, including organs, cells, and biomolecules.
modules.title: Biomathematics

modules.description: Techniques in linear and nonlinear ODEs, and asymptotic analysis of integrals.
modules.title: Mathematical Methods 5

modules.description: Combinatorial algorithms and their efficiency, focussing on network flows and problems on graphs.
modules.title: Combinatorial Optimisation

modules.description: Discrete mathematics, including graph theory, combinatorics, emphasising extremal results and methods.
modules.title: Graph Theory and Combinatorics

modules.description: Construction and analysis of mathematical models used to understand population dynamics in ecology.
modules.title: Mathematical Ecology

modules.description: Foundations of finance and essentials of probability and stochastic calculus.
modules.title: Financial Mathematics

modules.description: A rigorous analysis of accuracy and stability of computational methods, including those in linear algebra and ODEs.
modules.title: Numerical Methods

modules.description: Elementary number theory, including equations, congruences, and the properties of integers and their rings.
modules.title: Number Theory

modules.description: Finite algebraic extensions of rational numbers (algebraic number fields) and their arithmetic.
modules.title: Algebraic Number Theory

modules.description: Study of curves of the form $y^2 = x^3 + ax^2 + bx + c$, with $a,b,c\in\mathbb{Q}$, and their rational solutions.
modules.title: Elliptic Curves

modules.description: An introduction to propositional and first order logic, including set theory and countability.
modules.title: Logic

modules.description: Evolution of mathematics from ancient times to the early 19th century, focusing on key figures and discoveries.
modules.title: History of Mathematics

modules.description: Calculus concepts suitable for students with a basic understanding of mathematics.
modules.title: Differential and Integral Calculus

modules.description: Strengthening A-level mathematics skills for students achieving high grades.
modules.title: Mathematics for Science 1

modules.description: Advanced mathematical concepts, including 3D geometry, calculus, and linear algebra, focusing on solving problems with matrices and vectors.
modules.title: Mathematics for Science 2

modules.description: Advanced mathematical techniques crucial for solving complex chemical problems.
modules.title: Mathematical Methods in Chemistry

modules.description: Advanced mathematical techniques crucial for theoretical physics and astronomy study.
modules.lead: Dr A Pokrovskiy and Dr J Talbot
modules.title: Mathematics for Physics and Astronomy

modules.description: Applying mathematical techniques to economics, statistics, and related fields through practical examples.
modules.title: Calculus and Linear Algebra

modules.description: Mastering advanced mathematical techniques through problem-solving and application.
modules.title: Calculus in Several Dimensions

modules.description: Mathematical concepts, particularly matrices and linear algebra, through examples and theoretical explanations.
modules.title: Advanced Linear Algebra

modules.description: This module introduces fundamental mathematical concepts, particularly rigorous proofs and definitions, crucial for advanced studies in economics and statistics.
modules.title: Mathematical Analysis

modules.description: Introductory first order logic, computability, and undecidability.
modules.title: Logic

modules.description: Convergence, continuity, compactness, and contractions in metric spaces.
modules.title: Analysis 4: Real Analysis

modules.description: Groups of small order, Sylow's theorems, and the fundamentals of ring theory.
modules.title: Algebra 4: Groups and Rings

modules.description: Rotating frames, Lagrangian and Hamiltonian dynamics, and rigid body motion, with an emphasis on formal development of the theory.
modules.title: Analytical Dynamics

modules.description: An introduction to electromagnetism and relativistic mechanics.
modules.title: Mathematics of Electromagnetism and Special Relativity

modules.description: Separation of variables in cylindrical and spherical coordinates, and transform methods for PDEs.
modules.title: Mathematical Methods 4

modules.description: Axiomatic approach to probability and related statistical methods.
modules.title: Probability and Statistics

modules.description: Numerical methods in linear algebra and its applications through Python programming.
modules.title: Computational Methods

modules.description: Units in number fields, class numbers, L-functions, and class field theory, as the basis for the Langlands programme.
modules.title: Further Topics in Algebraic Number Theory

modules.description: Techniques for mathematical modelling, including perturbation methods and solution methods for PDEs.
modules.title: Advanced Modelling Mathematical Techniques

modules.description: The rigorous theory of probability, focussing on the strong law of large numbers and the central limit theorem.
modules.title: Probability

modules.description: An introduction to distributions, the Fourier transform in various spaces, elliptic regularity, and harmonic functions.
modules.title: Linear Partial Differential Equations

modules.description: Fundamental theory behind the operators used in quantum mechanics, including the Riesz representation theorem and the spectral theorem for compact self-adjoint operators.
modules.title: Spectral Theory

modules.description: Representations of finite groups over the complex numbers, including Maschke's theorem, Schur's lemma, classification, and characters.
modules.title: Representation Theory

modules.description: Fundamental groups, free groups, and group presentations, including the Wirtinger presentation.
modules.title: Topology and Groups

modules.description: Algebraic structure of Lie groups and their representations, utilising tools from geometry and linear algebra.
modules.title: Lie Groups and Lie Algebras

modules.description: The study of algebraic varieties, defined by polynomial equations, with a focus on basic notions and explicit examples.
modules.title: Algebraic Geometry

modules.description: Flows of Newtonian fluids, taking into account for viscosity (internal friction) and exploring a range of examples, instabilities, and techniques.
modules.title: Real Fluids

modules.description: Systematic methods for solving problems involving a small parameter, enabling progress where exact solutions are unavailable.
modules.title: Asymptotic Approximation Methods

modules.description: History and structure of the universe through the study of general relativity, including the expansion rate of the universe and cosmological perturbations.
modules.title: Cosmology

modules.description: Linear and nonlinear wave theory and techniques for analysing wave reflection, transmission, and scattering in various media.
modules.title: Waves and Wave Scattering

modules.description: Introductions to evolutionary game theory and population genetics, including mutation-selection balance and Mendelian genetics.
modules.title: Evolutionary Games and Population Genetics

modules.description: Properties of prime numbers, culminating in proofs of Dirichlet's theorem and the prime number theorem.
modules.title: Prime Numbers and their Distribution

modules.description: Experience independent research-style mathematics with a supervisor over two terms.
modules.title: Project

modules.description: Numerical methods for solving ODEs, PDEs, and linear systems, including classical stability analysis.
modules.title: Computational and Simulation Methods

modules.description: Developing the PDE approach to the pricing of options, including an introduction to Excel for computation.
modules.title: Quantitative and Computational Finance

modules.description: Mathematical foundations of modern variational theory and numerical methods for PDEs, including applied functional analysis.
modules.title: Variational Methods for PDEs

modules.description: Learn fundamental linear algebra concepts (vectors, matrices, and least squares) essential for data science applications.
modules.title: Linear Algebra for Data Science

modules.description: Applying stochastic differential equations to model physical, chemical, and biological systems.
modules.title: Applied Stochastic Methods

modules.description: Developing a strong understanding of group theory and number theory through abstract concepts and rigorous proof techniques.
modules.title: Discrete Mathematics

modules.description: Concepts and applications of modular forms, including Eisenstein series, theta series, and Hecke operators.
modules.title: Modular Forms

modules.description: The probabilistic method and its applications across combinatorics, number theory, and geometry.
modules.title: Probabilistic Method in Combinatorics

modules.description: Principles of commutative algebra and algebraic geometry, including integral extensions of rings.
modules.title: Commutative Rings and Algebras

modules.description: A practical course teaching students how to formally prove mathematical theorems interactively using the Lean programming language.
modules.title: Theorem Proving in Lean

modules.description: Fundamental concepts in mathematical analysis, focusing on rigorous proofs and logical thinking.
modules.title: Analysis for Joint Honours

modules.description: Core principles and practical applications of machine learning and artificial intelligence.
modules.lead: Dr Alejandro Dias and Dr Luca Grieco
modules.title: Mathematics for Machine Learning

modules.description: Modelling elastic materials through the PDEs of linear elasticity.
modules.title: Solid Mechanics

modules.description: Modelling biological phenomena that occur over space and time, with a focus on PDE models, Turing patterns, and their origins.
modules.title: Spatial Mathematical Biology

modules.description: Mathematical foundations of quantum mechanics through approximation methods and key concepts like the Schrödinger equation and quantum states.
modules.title: Mathematics for Quantum Mechanics

modules.description: Tools and techniques for analysing and modelling dynamical systems through topology, analysis, and measure theory.
modules.title: Dynamical Systems

modules.description: Economic principles and modelling techniques.
modules.lead: Prof N Ovenden and Dr A Donov
modules.title: Economics 2
